title: The Rays Have a Shot at an All-Time Baseball Stunner
text:
ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.—There are very few real upsets in the Major League Baseball postseason. The history of randomness this time of year is too great—and the playoff teams too close in talent—to believe too strongly in what is or isn’t possible in the course of a mere five or seven games. But there is a very real upset brewing in the American League.

The Houston Astros, winners of a major-league-high 107 games during the regular season, led the Tampa Bay Rays, 2-0, in the best-of-five ALDS when they arrived at Tropicana Field...
description: The Tampa Bay Rays forced a Game 5 in the ALDS after winning their second straight game against the heavily favored Houston Astros.
